meanings.definition: An object made by a human being, typically of cultural or historical interest.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed ancient artefacts from Egypt.
meanings.sent2: Archaeologists unearthed artefacts from the Roman Empire.
meanings.sent3: The artefacts in the exhibit seemed to whisper stories of the past.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of artefacts was a window into different civilizations.
meanings.sent5: The artefacts gleamed under the museum lights, captivating visitors.

meanings.definition: A structure or feature not normally present but visible as a result of an external agent or action.
meanings.sent1: The rainbow was a beautiful artefact of the sunlight passing through raindrops.
meanings.sent2: The footprints in the sand were artefacts of the beachgoers' activities.
meanings.sent3: The mysterious artefact in the forest turned out to be a hidden treasure chest.
meanings.sent4: The old house bore artefacts of its former grandeur in its intricate architecture.
meanings.sent5: The shooting star left an artefact of light streaking across the night sky.
